what we do

Hatha yoga

(The word "Hatha" means "Force" in Sanskrit.)

"Hatha" yoga is a broad term. One may say it is a form spirit and body culture. The most accepted definition of Hatha is movement. In that sense, every yoga class in which asana's (yoga poses) are practised is a Hatha yoga class. The goal of Hatha yoga is for the trainee to focus on their breath and connect with inner-self. Breathing is the connection with Ones mind and body. Proper breathing enhances vitality and lung function and contributes to relaxation. This way the student accomplishes inner harmony and serenity. Hatha yoga builds up flexibility and strength, not only for the body, but for the mind also. This is yoga practise balances and opens the whole body. The poses are done at ease building on each other in a calming rhythm. The goal is flexibility of the body and strenghteing the muscles at the same time with relieving Ones self of physical and mental stress. the result is deep relaxation. Every class consists of relaxation and centering at the start, warm up exercises, practising asanas (yoga poses), getting to know breathing technics (pranjama), and end relaxation with yoga Nidra. Classes are for all, new and advance yoga practicants.

×

Sarga yoga

(The word "Sarga" mean "Nature" in Sanskrit.)

Connect with nature and with the help of yoga technique, discover your own. Guided Hatha yoga classes are held outside in nature during the spring summer season. The goal with this kind of yoga practise is connecting with nature (universal elements earth, water, fire, air, ether) and life energy. The word yoga in Sanskrit mean to connect. Developing awareness through yoga, we are exploring our connection with the ground beneath our feet and the ambience around us. To be aware and be one with nature and the universe is one of the main aspects of yoga practise. Most of the asanas reflect natures elements. Positioning ourself into tree pose we are learning how to ground ourself and breathing in the wave cycles of water gives us a sense of harmony and timeless connection with the universe.

The teacher

(Aleksandra Janković)
